subject: HowStuffWorks Automotive Newsletter June 12, 2007

howstuffworks® | automotive June 12, 2007
RSS
 
 Ferrari
  Whether you're a car expert or casual enthusiast,
Ferrari defines motoring excitement. Learn about the greatest Ferrari road and racing cars -- and the people who designed them, built and drove them -- in our picture-packed celebration of Ferrari history.
 
Also at HowStuffWorks 


How HEMI Engines Work -The word "HEMI"
has become a synonym for big, powerful engines. Learn about the legendary HEMI
engine and find out what sets a HEMI apart from other engine types.
 

How Tire Pressure Gauges
Work - If you have a car, chances
are you also have a tire-pressure gauge. Learn how this pen-sized device
measures air pressure and why the little stick inside doesn't just fly right
out the back.
 
How Airbags Work - Airbags inflate in a fraction of a second, and they can reduce the risk of dying in a head-on crash by 30 percent. Learn about airbag inflation, airbag design and what that powdery substance is. 
  
Want more from HowStuffWorks? We've recently added 12 new RSS feeds. Besides the Daily Feature you can now enjoy feeds from Entertainment, Health, Auto, Home and Garden, Science and more.
